subject: Science
title: Why We Lost Our Fur
description: Learn Why We Lost Our Fur in one minute.

hook.text: Humans are the only primates that are nearly hairless. Why did we lose our fur?

buildup.text: One theory: as we moved to open savannas, we needed to cool down by sweating.

discovery.text: Fur traps heat. Losing it and gaining sweat glands let us run long distances without overheating.

twist.text: Humans are the best endurance runners on Earth. We can outrun horses over long distances.

punchline.text: We lost fur to sweat better. That made us the deadliest marathon runners on the planet.

quiz.question: Why did humans lose most of their body hair?
options: To cool down through sweating during endurance running
To look more attractive to mates
